Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the incident by stating that Kerala college students raised a Pakistani flag, when in fact it was the flag of the MSF.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on media reports without proper fact-checking.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the students intentionally raised a Pakistani flag, when it was actually a result of a misunderstanding and lack of knowledge about flag design.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the flag raised by the students was not the Pakistani flag but the flag of the MSF.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not including the word "allegedly" in the title of the reports, leading to a potentially misleading representation of the incident.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the students raised the flag unknowingly, due to a lack of knowledge about flag design.
